meanings.definition: A person or thing that has the same name as another.
meanings.sent1: My friend's dog, also named Max, is the namesake of my own dog.
meanings.sent2: The famous actor named his son after his own namesake.
meanings.sent3: It can be confusing when two classmates have the same namesake in school.
meanings.sent4: The ancient statue stood as a namesake of the goddess of wisdom.
meanings.sent5: The old library was a namesake of the town's founder, preserving his memory.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that is named after another.
meanings.sent1: The new restaurant, a namesake of the original, serves delicious food.
meanings.sent2: The ship was named after its namesake, a famous explorer.
meanings.sent3: The little girl felt special being the namesake of her grandmother.
meanings.sent4: The tree planted in his honor became a namesake of the fallen soldier.
meanings.sent5: The street was a namesake of the city's first mayor, honoring his legacy.
